conbody.p: There are six trend line types in Excel. It is not always immediately obvious what kind of trend line is the best choice for your data. Sometimes you see it right away and if not, you have to experiment with some different trend lines.

The quality of a trend line can be judged by the value of R-squared (R2). This is a number from 0 to 1 that indicates how close the calculates values are to the actual values. The closer to 1 the better the trend line. When you add a trend line you can select to display the R-squared value and the equation of the trend line in the chart.
When making predictions you need the coefficients of the equation. Excel provides in worksheet functions for these coefficients.
